title: 21 Savage
summary: Sh√©yaa Bin Abraham-Joseph (born October 22, 1992), known professionally as 21 Savage, is a rapper, songwriter, and record producer. Born in London, he moved to Atlanta with his mother at age seven.[3] He became known for the 2015 mixtape The Slaughter Tape before attaining nationwide attention following an EP with producer Metro Boomin called Savage Mode (2016), and its popular singles "X" (featuring Future) and "No Heart", as well as guest features on Drake's 2016 single "Sneakin'" and Post Malone's 2017 single "Rockstar".[4][5][6][7]
